intro: Acrocephalus descampsii, commonly known as the African marsh grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant has slender, grass-like blades that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, and it produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowering period usually occurs during the late spring and summer months. Acrocephalus descampsii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small aquatic organisms.
